MLP-007: Bubble Shield Hardware Protocol (Mandatory Sensory Fix)

PURPOSE: To define and mandate the use of sensory mitigation tools as non-negotiable assistive technology. This hardware is required to maintain stable executive function and prevent sensory overload/burnout. Treating these items as ‚Äúwants‚Äù is a non-conforming condition.

1.0 AUDITORY FIX (THE ‚ÄúSOUND FILTER‚Äù)

Non-Conforming Condition: Unpredictable, unpleasant noise (airplanes, voices, police sirens). Mandatory Hardware: Noise-Cancelling Headphones (Soundcore Space One or equivalent). Protocol: Headphones are required during all dedicated work/focus periods and system transitions. Function: Use Profile 1.0 (Transparency 3) for deep focus or Profile 2.0 (Transparency 5) for high-vigilance/family mode (refer to 2025-11-08_M4_CONFIG_gemini-master-bootstrap-v2.md for profile details).

2.0 VISUAL FIX (THE ‚ÄúLIGHT FILTER‚Äù)

Non-Conforming Condition: Overstimulation from harsh, bright, or flickering light sources (fluorescents, sunlight, screen glare). Mandatory Hardware: Sunglasses (or Blue-Light Filtering Glasses). Protocol: Sunglasses must be kept at the Command Center (desk) and used:

  1. Immediately upon leaving the house.
  2. When working on a computer screen for more than 2 hours (use blue-light filters).
  3. When working in any environment with harsh overhead lighting.

3.0 TACTILE/MOTION FIX (THE ‚ÄúGROUNDING SYSTEM‚Äù)

Non-Conforming Condition: Internal restlessness (ADHD/Vyvanse response) and difficulty transitioning focus. Mandatory Hardware (Examples):

  • Weighted Blanket/Vest: For evening ‚ÄúShutdown‚Äù Transition (refer to 2025-11-09_M4_SOP_002-rigid-foundations.md) or during high-anxiety focus blocks. Provides stabilizing deep pressure input.
  • Fidget Cube/Tool: Must be kept on the desk during all ‚ÄúWork Blocks‚Äù (Priority #7). It allows restless energy to be channeled into a quiet, structured motor pattern, preventing the energy from causing cognitive disruption.
  • Ergonomic Chair/Standing Desk: A flexible, adjustable workstation is required to accommodate positional shifts and movement during long work sessions.

4.0 OTHER CRITICAL SENSORY ITEMS

The underlying cause of many daily ‚Äúnon-conforming conditions‚Äù is sensory input mismatch. Other items that often transition from ‚Äúwant‚Äù to ‚Äúneed‚Äù for neurodivergent individuals include:

  • Non-Verbal Communication Aids: A small, easy-to-read whiteboard or notebook (like Google Keep) used to communicate simple needs (e.g., ‚ÄúIn a meeting, do not disturb,‚Äù ‚Äú5 minutes until dinner‚Äù) to children or family members without relying on verbal, reciprocal communication, which is often difficult.
  • Textured/Comfort Items: Specific clothing textures, soft throws, or comfort objects used during ‚ÄúShutdown‚Äù or periods of high stress.
  • Routine Visuals: A visible, analog clock or a prominent visual schedule (e.g., the whiteboard for the ‚ÄúFamily Structure‚Äù mode) to ease the difficulty of transitions and reduce reliance on abstract time concepts.
